Reviews.Content: my unit came with an installed calendar, which was advertized as being able to synch with my outlook calendar on my laptop. when it would not work  I tried manually entering data. even that would not work.  i went to the direct personal support system. they were unable to provide a solution and after a long delay they gave up. I eventually downloaded another calender system which , while not able to synch at least I was able to input data.
Reviews.Title: poor support

Reviews.Author: tink1333
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier! My brother just bought the new iPad air & he even had to admit, the Kindle Fire HDX has a greater clarity then any tablet put there on the market.
Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX - 7

Reviews.Author: Ricardo from California
Reviews.Content: Is an easy way to surf trough internet. It has the perfect size to handle it. The sound is awesome. I can do almost everything  without a big effort. I really like my kindle fire. (My daughter's christmas gift)
Reviews.Title: MY WONDERFUL DEVICE!

Reviews.Author: Donna M. Weigel "Donna Weigel"
Reviews.Content: I had a kindle before the Kindle fire ( and I waited for the HD version) that I loved but was becoming limited since I also wanted to convenience of checking email and going on the internet, following links in a ebook etc.  I was so in love with my regular kindle and was a reading fool on that thing. I had a relationship with it. Let’s face it, I slept with it more than I have any man. Lol.  Giving it up and moving on was not an easy decision.Kindle vs Kindle Fire HD vs Fire HDX.Kindle:  Love the light shining on the book rather back lit.  It is far less stressful reading.  The gray background allowed me to read forever easily.  I loved how easy it was to organize books. However, it had become limited.  I couldn’t really surf the internet, magazines and pictures wouldn’t work on it well and it was black and white.  Pretty sure you know the rest.Kindle Fire:  I don’t by the first of anything because it will improve and become cheaper.  The biggest issue with the kindle fire was it didn’t have a reader and I do use that often.  The front page was a bookshelf which is ok but couldn’t organize like the reg kindle.Kindle Fire HD:  I hate the carousel on kindle fire HD.  It’s a circle of icons in which the last thing you opened goes up there.  Want it or not.  You can delete from the carousel but something else will pop up there that is on your device. It has a set number of icons it wants there and it will keep it filled.  Grrr.  I wish it would just go away.  I liked how I could organize my books on the regular kindle.  That said, there are apps that make that happen so it makes life easier. You know there HAS to be an app for that!  Over all the organization isn’t bad. It’s simple to use.  My six year old can use it no problem. But then again, kids are born knowing these things today.  Being back lit vs light shining on the book isn’t as easy to read as the original kindle was.  The back light can be adjusted way down which is a plus. I don’t think this is a big issue to most people.  I’m dyslexic and having dimmer light on the gray background rocked!  I could be a reading fool.  I can’t read as long on this.  As I said though for most people that probably isn’t an issue.  After my withdraw from my original kindle I love this one.  SO much more you can do with it!!  The battery doesn’t last like the original but we are doing WAY more with this one than just read.  AND naturally there is an app for that!!!  There are battery savers that shut down what isn’t needed and does make a difference in battery life.  Considering with I do however I think the battery isn’t bad. I play music and a game at the same time or music and read, music and read.  I am asking a lot! I was use to the other battery lasting for weeks.  One plus is my phone charger works for the kindle.  I’m just overall too happy with the upgrade to Kindle Fire HD.HD vs HDX.I got the HD with Ads because I didn’t care to pay to not have them. I’m really glad I did that.  I like the ads.  There were some movie and TV trailers that I would have otherwise missed.  Product ads you never know but they aren't annoying at all.My son bought the HDX.  He loves it.As far as I can tell the big difference is with the HDX you can have Wifi and cell towers.  Oh and the live help.  I asked if I could upgrade because it came out right after I bought my HD. The answer was no, I would need to sell it myself.  I’m glad I didn’t. I don’t need to use cell towers.  Some might where they live but I don’t.  As for live help, once you learn your kindle do you really need that?  I didn’t for the price difference.  Last I knew it was a good $200 difference.  I’m sure the price will go down, the HD will be priced at peanuts and it will all balance out in time.  It seems about a year is when the big price change happens.Good luck with your new decisions!
Reviews.Title: Kindle vs Kindle Fire HD vs Fire HDX

Reviews.Author: Juan Pablo
Reviews.Content: A very smooth tablet. Everything runs fast, games never lag and things load very quickly.My only complaint is that the camera is very sub par. The image is extremely poor, the quality is that of a phone camera from 2004.
Reviews.Title: Works very smooth

Reviews.Author: Heather Mason
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle, best gift my husband has given me for Christmas.  I do everything on it, check mail, play games and read.
Reviews.Title: I love my kindle

Reviews.Author: 1Rare1
Reviews.Content: We purchased this as a Xmas present for our 6yr old daughter.  We own several Apple products, but no Amazon electronics.  I was reluctant to start over with a new eco-system, but we are Amazon Prime customers so the added content was appealing.  I do like the parent features on the Kindle Fire.  They are simple and fairly intuitive.  My biggest concern was their app store.  As they have not drawn nearly as many developers to their store as Apple or Google.  With that said, so far it has not been an issue.  Our daughter has been able to find most all the apps she was looking for.  I think as the Kindle continues to gain traction, the developers will obviously go where the customers are.  I'm highly impressed with the device itself.  Some of the motions aren't as smooth as my Ipad, but not terribly noticeable.  It has a  very nice picture resolution.  Much better than my Ipad 2.  The hardware is top notch and at this price, hard to turn away from.  I would definitely recommend this as a purchase for younger people.  I also think, depending on your needs, it works quite well for adults.  The Silk web browser works fine and hasn't presented any noticeable disadvantages.  All in all, nice purchase.
Reviews.Title: Pleased so far.

Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HDX 7 for my husband for Christmas. I was finally able to completely surprise him this year!  He was flat floored. It is hard for him to put down, and he keeps finding more things he can do with it. Lol. I am the "best wife ever" right now.
Reviews.Title: HDX 7

Reviews.Author: Lynn McNamee
Reviews.Content: I have owned the first Kindle, the second one, and the first Fire. My hubby got the Kindle Fire HDX 7 for me for Christmas this year.I hadn't asked for it, as I was still happy with my Fire, but after using it a bit, I was really happy to have it.The display is clearer, and there are many new features.I did have one small issue:I plug in a headset to use my Fire at night in bed. In the morning, I unplug it and just use the speakers during the day. However, the speakers occasionally wouldn't work. I discovered the problem - a faulty jack. To make the speakers work again, I would have to plug in and unplug the headset again.I called Amazon CS, and they sent me a new one. (One wonderful thing about them is that I was allowed to keep my original until the new one arrived. Since that was the only problem, I was very happy about it.)The new one has the exact same problem.Because of all the horror return stories and because it's a minor issue, I'm just going to keep it. Also, my fear is that this is just a design flaw that may be present in all or most of them.Other than that, I LOVE my Kindle Fire HDX! :-)
Reviews.Title: Book Reader, Game Player, and One Weird Glitch

Reviews.Author: steambeaver
Reviews.Content: got this for my IT techie daughter, she loves it, got it on the one day special, shipping was fast.
Reviews.Title: great gift

Reviews.Author: Robert Konka
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it.. The color is nice and bright, the system is quick and easy for her to learn to use.  My wife is a beginner when it comes to electronics, but she treats it just like a laptop and is very happy.
Reviews.Title: she loves it

Reviews.Author: Laura Monson
Reviews.Content: My Kindle goes every where with me. It is so much better then I thought it would be..  I bought a second for my Grand son an he never puts it down.. Good or bad he loves it too.it does everything an more than an Ipad.. Love it
Reviews.Title: The best thing ever.

Reviews.Author: Kayline Allison
Reviews.Content: I loved the fact that I could use my thank you points to apply to this purchases payment.  Kindle's speak for themselves.  I am glad that I got the smaller one, it fits nicely in my purse.
Reviews.Title: My very own Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: Tamara Zylstra
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle. It has awesome graphics but it is hard learning where everything is. It's a learning process. Yes I would recommend it to friends.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: Patricia Smith
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use; light enough to hold for 30 minutes or more without causing pain or fatigue. images are very clear and most of all the battery life is excellent. I have used it everyday for last three weeks.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7"

Reviews.Author: Mary Chitwood
Reviews.Content: What can I say. I bought two of them for our girls. They absolutely love them. Can't seem to put them down. Thanks.
Reviews.Title: Love it.

Reviews.Author: ZIPPER BOOKS "ZIPPER BOOKS"
Reviews.Content: got it on Black Friday prices,  pulled out of a drawer Christmas Eve and asked if she knew anything about it, she didnt want to open cause she didnt want to try to return, but when she realized what it was she was screaming like a little girl, a 52 yo little girl, nice present, nice free apps to get
Reviews.Title: replaced her Kindle from a couple years ago

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I really love the screen and makes reading my kindle books so much easier.  The videos work great with my prime membership.  The negatives are that you are restricted to the Amazon app store which has less then the Google Play store (much less).  Also the battery life is not the greatest when reading.  I know I am spoiled by my old Kindle but you can always wish for more battery life.
Reviews.Title: You got to love this

Reviews.Author: donna dye
Reviews.Content: It is the right size and easy to take with you. It was a gift for my husband but it greets me since I ordered it.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx 7

Reviews.Author: Elaine L Jacques
Reviews.Content: just plain enjoy it wish it would have a basic instruction booklet, I purchased an instruction guide, would have rather had something in my hand to follow instead of jumping screen to screen
Reviews.Title: kindle fire HDX

Reviews.Author: Chris Hedlund
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for this device. I tried with all my power to like the Kindle. But in the end, I will be returning this device. The hardware is excellent, and the user interface is pretty good as well. But odd behavior kept occurring. The device once went into a boot loop while I was at work without a charger. It continuously rebooted all day long. Nothing I did would stop the boot loop. Finally when I got home and plugged it into the charger, it booted back to the UI. I also have been noticing the screen flicker at times. It's more of an annoyance than a problem. There are other odd things that I can't recall at the moment. But ultimately, it's the battery life that prompts me to return the Kindle. Fully charged at 100% and left over night will find the device down to 88% without use. Then, when I pick the device up and actually use it, the battery is down to needing another charge within 1 or 2 (maybe 3) hours. Not heavy usage either, playing Candy Crush then browsing Facebook will do it. One time, I plugged the Kindle into charge before leaving for work, only to come home eight hours later and find that the screen was still on, and the device hadn't gone up 1% in battery charge. Another time, I plugged the device in for the night at 68%, went to bed and woke up to find the device charged only to 77%. Meanwhile, my Nexus 7 was at 14%, plugged in at the same time and was at 100% the next morning. I just can't have a device that I am constantly worried about keeping charged all the time. So, in the end, this device has been boxed back up and will be going back to Amazon. I hope to give the Kindle another try some time in the future.
Reviews.Title: Disappointment

Reviews.Author: Mika McFadden
Reviews.Content: Kindle is great, the problem is that my 9 year old had instant access to 1-click purchasing and had ready spent over $100 on Amazon before I saw what was happening.
Reviews.Title: Be careful with kids!

Reviews.Author: Robin Goutremout
Reviews.Content: I did not like the way the camera was. and also thought you could use a printer with it but could not do so..I am looking at the kindle fire hdx 8.9 but not sure if i will. the price is a bit high might have to go with adifferent tablet all together.
Reviews.Title: was disapointed

Reviews.Author: t schmoeger
Reviews.Content: Updated Review:The Kindle Fire works great for most things you can normally do on the internet, and it has clear sound and picture display. I bought the tablet so I could watch my television shows while I eat without having to hall around my laptop around. And for this purpose I would give the Kindle Fire a B+.After my initial posting, describing my disappointment with Kindles ability/or lack there of to watch free streaming media, Amazon reached out to me. Which really impressed me! They pushed out some updates to me, gave me pointers on how to ensure I am on the tablet version of common websites (since videos won't work on all of the regular sites), and ABC published an updated app for viewing episodes. Now I am largely happy with the Kindle's ability to watch streaming videos. The only downsides I have experienced is the Hulu is not available (you can access hulu plus but not the free site), the volume/sound projection abilities don't seem as good as some of my other devices (like my ipod), and you can only have one window/tab open at a time. So for instance if I want to check the news during a commercial you can't do it- which is a downside for me since I am a multi-tasker. However, I am largely happy with my purchase, and am definitely happy with Amazon's customer service!
Reviews.Title: Good device

Reviews.Author: David P O'Bryan
Reviews.Content: It delivered improved performance as advertised.I gave it to my wife for Christmas.  She gave me an I=Pad Air and I was so diapponted by comparison that I returned it.If it is offered at $259 again, I will buy a second unit that will replace my Nexus 7.
Reviews.Title: I am totally satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Author: Susan Greaves
Reviews.Content: The battery runs out way too quickly. Not sure if the item is defective or if this is the case with all kindle's.
Reviews.Title: Battery runs out way too quickly.

Reviews.Author: samantha
Reviews.Content: Best purchase my husband could have made for me (aside from my engagement ring)! He almost purchased the Nexus 7 but the HDX was $50 off during cyber Monday, so he took a chance. After a week of playing around on it when I wasn't looking, he was 100% positive he had made the right choice! There is nothing about this product I dislike! The screen is so brilliant and crisp, and the mayday feature is wicked cool! I would advise people to stop throwing there money away on iPads and enjoy a kindle fire HDX!
Reviews.Title: My husband is brilliant!

Reviews.Author: ldytubird
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX. I can't hardly put it down. I carry it everywhere just in case I get an additional chance to read.
Reviews.Title: Review: Kindle Fire HDX

Reviews.Author: Erycka923
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my new Kindle!! It is light, the picture is CLEAR, and fits perfectly in my purse!! I've told everyone I know they need to buy one!!
Reviews.Title: Best 2013 Self bought Christmas gift!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Amazon has tweaked the android operating system to prevent using Google Chrome as a browser and to prevent using Google Drive as a cloud storage utility.  In effect then, you have to use the supplied browser and use Amazon's cloud storage.  They may work OK, but I am frustrated by not being able to use the systems I have been using for quite some time.  By the way, I am able to use all Google systems on my Apple iPad!!!  In retrospect, had I known what I now know, I would have bought a Nexus rather than the Kindle Fire HDX.All that being said, I guess it will work as a reading and music device so long as I am satisfied with the Amazon reader and music player - which I am since I use them on the iPad.
Reviews.Title: WARNING!!!  WARNING!!!

Reviews.Author: Baaaaaay
Reviews.Content: My first tablet.  It's fast.  Much faster than my HTC sensation 4g.  It also has amazing picture quality.  I also got Prime and have been watching shows almost every day.  It came already registered to me, which was convenient if not a little scary (I'm a privacy rights supporter).My favorite thing about it is the battery life.  I can go days without plugging it in.  I am not constantly on it, but I do use it for a few hours each day, about half of which is streaming shows.  I'm taking a trip soon and I'm stoked to have something I know will last the whole plane ride.Finally, the keyboard is great and the Swype works much better than it does on my phone.  It's very convenient for typing and entering information.All in all I'm am quite satisfied.  I'm writing this about a month after receiving this and have had quite a bit of play time on it.
Reviews.Title: Awesome!

Reviews.Author: Dennis Meehan
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle HDX for my son as a Christmas present. It is a terrific little machine and works flawlessly. The price is also unbeatable. It has enough apps to keep him busy and I appreciate the parental controls. We don't have any issues with the screen. I like it so much that I'm going to buy one for myself despite the high switching cost of a large iTunes music collection.
Reviews.Title: Perfect for Me

Reviews.Author: Chres parker
Reviews.Content: Haven't had enough time with it yet but I' m pretty haapy with my HDX so far. I've noticed a few quirks, but it may be just me. Wish it came with iespell checker.
Reviews.Title: So far so good

Reviews.Author: Bobio
Reviews.Content: I bought this because my Kindle Fire HD was refusing to function when there was still about 38% battery life left. The HDX is slimmer, lighter, and the operating system is more user-friendly. There are more pixels so the display is a lot clearer. I was surprised to find the sound quality of the HD is better than the HDX. But the battery life of the HDX is much better. Overall, I'm glad I bought the HDX.
Reviews.Title: I love it

Reviews.Author: obiken "obiken"
Reviews.Content: First of all if you are deciding what is the best tablet good luck, it depends on what you want it for. I owned the Apple mini with Retina, and I will again. However, if you are looking for the fastest WiFi, the best sound BY FAR, the best books, and movies, the Kindle Fire HDX is your huckleberry.You cannot beat the Apple for ease of use, or the apps. IF Kindle had access to all the Apple 3rd party apps, due to the price difference, it would be game over.However for Netflix, and internet browsing its not even close. KFHDX is way faster. So yes, sometimes the experts are right!!
Reviews.Title: Just the fastest period!!

Reviews.Author: yellowstar2000 "Candice Collins"
Reviews.Content: Love love love this!!! Couldn't be happier!! Well... it could always be better but I have yet to find anything I do not love about it!!
Reviews.Title: perfect gift!!!

Reviews.Author: Bob Feil
Reviews.Content: Totally surprised her with it. She is constantly looking for books to read, now she just looks them up and she is all set. Skypeing our grand kids is a special treat as well,It's like having a lap top only smaller. Great product, would suggest this to friends and family.
Reviews.Title: This was a Birthday gift for my wife.

Reviews.Author: MAMALICIOUS
Reviews.Content: Better than my iPad.  Affordable, efficient, and fun.  Android based little powerhouse.  If you're looking for a mini tablet or full sized one, check the new Kindle out.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet.  Better than my ipad.  Check it out.

Reviews.Author: cbcloud
Reviews.Content: A great tablet at a great price.  Display is amazingly sharp, and the android OS is very fast.  I've had it less than a month, but am using it as much as my laptop.  Battery life is much better than my 4G cellphone.  Only improvement I can suggest is a forward-facing camera in addition to the rear-facing one.  This is my 2nd Kindle, and both of them are excellent quality and simple to use.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a great price...

Reviews.Author: Lynn Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought the original Kindle Fire, which I liked, but this edition I love. It is so light, and just the right size to hold.
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: Ted augustine
Reviews.Content: Only thing that is really lacking is a USB port otherwise it is a great little product. Was so impressed I bought another one for my son.Ted A
Reviews.Title: Rating on Kindle Fire HDX

Reviews.Author: vg
Reviews.Content: after 2 months of deciding between the hdx and nexus 7 i went with the hdx and could not be happier.its everything amazon claims it to be.great purchase.
Reviews.Title: hdx review

Reviews.Author: Christopher Shively
Reviews.Content: Hardware is great! Very light, great screen, good battery life. OS & Web browser is good. App store is awful!!!!!!!!!! If you get this tablet with plans to use it to entertain your child(ren) Disney or Disney JR apps are not available in the app store. No Google Chromecast. The child or toddler apps I did download would freeze, not only the app but also the tablet! Also they would have annoying advertisements in the middle of use of the app and the "X" to close the ad would never be in one place. So my 3 year old son would hand me the tablet every time an ad came up so I could close it for him. This got pretty annoying! After a few days of using it, I just found myself not happy with it. I decide to reluctantly returned it. This device has so much promise. All it needs is a suitable app store. I guess I'm going to pay $200 more for and Ipad which I didn't want to do in the first place. Amazon you need to fix your App store
Reviews.Title: Great Hardware, Horrible App store!

Reviews.Author: Music fan
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle Fire which I have really enjoyed.  Also have a full-size iPad which is a great size for watching movies in bed, but really too big/heavy to play games.  The original Kindle Fire has only 8 GB storage (partly taken up by software) so I wanted another smaller tablet.  It was between the new Kindle HDX or the new iPad mini.  One thing I didn't like about the iPad mini (besides the price tag) is that the bezzle on the long sides is so narrow, it is hard to hold the device without getting your thumb on the display (which screws up games).  When I saw the HDX on sale on Cyber Monday, I grabbed it.It's fast, thin, light and easy to hold for long periods of time.  I can't believe how light it is compared to my KFire! There are several design changes, such as the ability to show the percentage the battery is charged in the little icon in the top right corner. You have to swipe down from the top of the display to access settings and other utilities.  I got the 32 GB version, so there is plenty of room for games and other apps.  I did download a Prime Instant Video to watch off-line, but I don't like the small display for watching movies.About that display -- I compared the HDX to the original Fire, looking at the same page of a book that has alot of white space on it.  White is a color, and like all colors, it can be "warm" or "cool."  A cool white is "bluish", and a warm white will be a little yellowish.  When I compared the 2 kindle displays for a book, I was shocked to see something I never noticed before.  On the original Fire, the white is "cool/bluish" and there is yellowish tint seeping in around the edges of the pages of the book I was comparing!  This never bothered  me; as I said, I never noticed it.  On the new HDX, the opposite is true --  the color white is warm (yellowish) with the blue/purple (that so many have commented about) seeping in around the edges of the book.  I doubt that this will bother me, and I feel that the people who complained about this and sent back this beautiful little device because of it, need to get a life!  BTW, the page on the HDX doesn't look yellowish to me at all; it is only when compared side-by-side to the original Fire that you can detect the different tints to the white color.I love playing games on the HDX, as even fast running games (such as my favorite Temple Run 2) work without stalling.  And, I got Temple Run Oz (finally) which was not compatible with the original Fire.There are some design features I don't like, such as the way the charger sticks in at an angle.  But charging is very fast using the included charger. My only real issue now is the battery life.  I am currently charging it up, and I am going to see if I can get anything close to 10 hours of "mixed use" on it.  (Yes, there are ways to extend battery life, such as turning off wifi when not using it.  Search on the internet for other tips.)Edit about battery life:  I usually find that when products are advertised as "up to X hours on a single battery charge (depending on settings, usage, blah blah blah)"  I usually get half that. What concerned me about the HDX was that I had fallen asleep with the HDX unplugged, watching a PREVIOUSLY DOWNLOADED movie (a 2.5 hour movie downloaded in "better" quality; after it finished, the display went into sleep mode)-- the next morning, the battery was showing only 35% charged from fully charged the night before.  Since many people posting on the forums with battery problems were told to do a "hard reboot"  I tried that then fully charged the battery again (luckily, charging is pretty quick.)  Downloading music, and letting the display go to sleep mode, the HDX lost only about 10% per hour.  But as soon as I picked it up and played some games for a little while (like Temple Run 2) the battery much more rapidly depleted (this is with wifi turned on, as music was simultaneously downloading).  Then I recharged it, and again tested that same 2.5 hour previously downloaded movie -- with wifi turned off, "airplane mode" turned on, and brightness set at about 70%, the battery drained from fully charged to 65%. So, finally, I downloaded a 2 hour SD quality movie to my HDX, and going from fully charged, with wifi off, and brightness lowered to about 50%, the battery went to 88%, losing only 12%.  Yes, a big improvement over my original KFire which lost double that, 25%, under the same conditions.When I got my HDX it was about 70% charged.  Looking in the settings, I saw that the software was up-to-date.  I was able to download content, read, and play games, without the HDX turning itself off and rebooting (as many have complained of).  The next morning, I saw a notification that there had been a software update -- one thing that was changed is that you can now put apps and books into "collections."  Not only that, but apparently my HDX "synced" wirelessly with my iPad Kindle reading app, where I had already put some books into collections.  Those same books now appear in collections on my HDX without my doing anything. Thank you Amazon.I give this 5 stars, certainly in comparison to the original Kindle Fire.  In general, this HDX is spectacular and the price is great.
Reviews.Title: Great Small Tablet; Love It!

Reviews.Author: Byzantine Dixie
Reviews.Content: I have been straddling the Apple / Android fence for a while now, with one foot in both camps.  But the time came to declare allegiance.  Music and video purchases are less and less dependent on hard media like CDs and DVDs and are becoming more and more cloud based.  Which cloud…that was the decision to make.So Amazon came out with fireTV…and I took the plunge and decide to go with Amazon for my video purchases.  I have been a prime member since its inception…and it is the first place I go to when I am looking to buy something.  I love Amazon…probably in an unwholesome way.With that decision behind me I was now free to find a device to take entertainment with me when I travel for work.  Do you have any idea how long and painful it can be to copy DVDs into digital files to take along when traveling…I simply did not have the patience to convert all 14 seasons Dallas!  I needed a device that would hold a number of videos to get me through at least 2 weeks overseas at a time.  Reliable streaming overseas is generally not an option for a variety of reasons.And so I bought a Kindle FireHDX (64MB, no ads) and have been absolutely delighted…I seriously couldn’t be happier.  It is so FAST…compared to my android ASUS transformer tablet.  The video quality is beautiful.  The sound is great and it is extremely simple to download videos…even Prime videos…to take along on my travels.Of course, nothing is perfect.  There are some disappointments but they are relatively minor.1) Battery life is disappointing if wifi is not disabled.  That has been my experience.  I will lose 15 – 20% overnight if I leave the wifi on.  With the wifi off…battery life is very good.  If there is an option to turn off wifi after being asleep for a while…I don’t know about it yet.  Long term, hopefully something like this will be developed in a software update.2) Lack of a mini HDMI out.  I like to plug my device into the HDMI ports of hotel TVs and watch my shows from the bigger screen.  When I realized too late that it had no HDMI out, I bought a Tronsmart miracast device.  It will work but not as smoothly or easily as a simple cable would.  I think the miracast is not quite ready for prime time yet.  It is not the end of the world if I can’t hook up the hotel TV.  Watching directly from the Kindle works well.3) Apps…need more.  I once had a Blackberry Playbook.  What awesome tablet that was…really.  Fine quality device, perfect in every way…except for the limited number of apps.  Amazon has to make this a priority.  And the apps need to work beautifully…like they do on my iPhone (see, I said I had one foot in both camps!)4) Flicker.  I notice a disturbing flicker with one of my apps.  Haven’t let determined if this is strictly a single app issue or if it will show up elsewhere.  I’ll update later if it is more than just this one app.All in all I feel this was a most self-indulgent purchase…it is such a sweet device and the perfect travel companion.  (Don’t tell my husband!)
Reviews.Title: Completely Self-Indulgent Purchase - Absolutely Delightful

Reviews.Author: Roy Cooper
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and have had it maybe month and everything stopped working can not even unlock screen when you reset it.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire 7 Quit working

Reviews.Author: Big Momma
Reviews.Content: Loved it! It took a minute but I caught on to it. Smooth operation of software and other functions. The input buttons are on an angle and it's a bit different plugging cords in. I'm used to a home or wake up button. I don't like to take my kindle fire HDX 7 outside the protective case just to get it going again. I wonder if the power button is gonna eventually wear out.
Reviews.Title: Easy To Use

Reviews.Author: Moosie
Reviews.Content: Oh My God!  I LOVE this Kindle.  This replaced my old Kindle Keyboard.  I didn't realize I was living in the dinosaur age with that until I bought this new one.  I wanted to treat myself to an early birthday present.  Amazon really pulled out all the stops with this one!  I'm so proud of this Kindle.It does just about everything a computer can do.  The colors, graphics are awesome!  Games on this Kindle HDX device are so vivid, clear and work flawlessly.  I love having access to my music, the downloads are faster and easier.  I downloaded a classical music radio app, and I am so pleased with this app.  I also love reading my books on it, the screen is easier to see, looks better.I am so happy with this purchase.  This thing is so precious to me.
Reviews.Title: Happier Than a Child at Christmas!

Reviews.Author: Khnet
Reviews.Content: Fantastic tablet, great for kids too. I love the kindle free time features and limits you can set. Easy access and fun to play with
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: bluewolf37
Reviews.Content: I have owned several different tablets and didn't wow me like i was hoping it was going to.Pros* The speakers are wonderful compared to all of my old tablets and some old laptops.* The touchscreen is the most responsive touchsreen that i have ever used. (i didn't realize my old tablet had lag until i used this)* it's fast all around from loading apps to starting a movie* The screen is beautiful when watching movies.* it feels very solid in the hands like it is built well.* If you have amazon prime you have access to the kindle lending library and amazon prime videos (this was the reason i decided on kindle this time)*the app store has comixology* It has a feature called Quiet time so you don't get notifications wanking you up when you are asleep* Wireless reception is very strong and stable.* Amazon music store is normally cheaper and better than itunes and the play store. (I love the fact that i don't have to download my music to every device i own to listen to it)* it is a good price.* Some movies and books have a wonderful feature called X-Ray that gives you useful information. In movies it can tell you the actors and actresses on screen and what song is playing. If you click in the names out connects to imdb for more info.Cons*you cannot connect to the play store and the amazon app store is extremely lacking and/or outdated. You can sideload some apps but any that connect to google services wont work 100%. For example I sideloaded chrome and even though I can use it to browse i cant sign in to sync bookmarks with my computer and phone. I also got the youtube app and it worked but once again you cant sign in to see all your subscriptions. Gmail is compleatly useless...Etc...*There is a blue haze around the edges of the screen that is almost painful when reading. I ended up changing kindle reading settings to a night mode so it didn't bother me.*apps that had no problems on other tablets or phones seem less stable on the kindle. I bought a game on the amazon app store and it ended up blue screening the device which was surprising since i never had a tablet give me the blue screen of death before (but to be fair it hasn't had a problem since then )* battery life when watching videos is worse than my asus tablet* you don't see the date when you pull down the notification barLast thoughts*It is probably a good idea to add a password to the kindle because it is always signed into amazon. This includes their kindle books store, app store, music store, and physical product store. So if you have kids or fear it may get stolen a password is a good idea. I would also look into the parental controls.
Reviews.Title: It's good but not great

Reviews.Author: JVR Mom
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th Kindle Fire we recieved.  #1 wouldnt connect to WiFi #2 Battery dead less than 90 mins #3 dead battery AND WIFI issues... i continues to give them a try becuase the Kindle Free time seemed like a good value for my 3 yr old.Unimpressed by Kindle Free time content.  Id prefer to spend a few bucks each month and own the content of my choice.  We will purchase another MS Surface Table and a kid friendly case.
Reviews.Title: Unreliable and Unimpressive

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought my very first tablet, the Kindle Fire. I was so excited when it arrived. I put on the screen protector, put it in it's case, set it up with my acct information. I was in awe of the look and feel of it. It is beautiful! The picture and sound are amazing too. If you love Amazon, this is probably exactly what you want!I went into the situation blind. I read a lot of kindle books so I thought the Fire would be great. I didn't understand that a tablet would block you from using specific programs they deem competition. I use Google Music, I pay for unlimited music each month. It never occurred to me that I wouldn't be able to stream my music over my tablet! It doesn't make any sense to me! My HTC phone, which uses google, lets me download Amazon apps so why wouldn't Amazon let me use Google?!I went into chat with an Amazon rep to find out if there was anything I could do to get my music on it. They said no, they were sorry. They said I was free to buy music from them tho. Of course I am but I don't want to buy every stupid song that pops into my head. I'd go broke!And they don't offer anything like unlimited streaming that I could switch to.In looking through the kindle apps, I also learned that the Google apps that are offered (maps, gmail) had horrible ratings with comments that they don't work at all.I am a HUGE Amazon fan. And even through this, I am a loyal customer. But I am  so deeply disappointed. I am disappointed that they have chosen an isolationist approach to their product. Having my music available to me would not have taken any dollars away from them. I still would have bought my books and movies through them. Probably a lot more than I do now. I don't buy my music thru Amazon, I buy it thru iTunes. I always have and I always will. I keep my music on Google Music. I use the unlimited music to hear new songs so I know if I want to buy it or not. By not letting me stream music they've lost book and movie purchases. They never would have had much music business from me. Maybe some, bec I might be too lazy to use iTunes. The thing is, I have my way of doing things. I use many products. I don't want to feel contained or limited or be forced into changing for literally a BAD BUSINESS decision by Amazon.I wanted the kindle bec I thought it might be nice to use in the kitchen or around the house specifically for entertainment purposes. Reading, music, movies, tv shows. A sort of all purpose entertainment center. Like they advertise. What they don't say on their product page is that you won't be able to use Google services. It should be very specific for people like me who are new to the tablet world. I bought a case and protective covers and the warranty.  Amazon is charging me money for the returns and some of it can't be returned. I feel like they withheld important information and now I am paying the price for it.I did some research last night and decided to go with the second generation Nexus. It will stream music, allow Amazon apps and it has a cute keyboard.  They don't force me into using them exclusively!Amazon is really on the wrong side of this!!
Reviews.Title: What a heartbreak! You Can't Use GOOGLE!

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I spent months reviewing and comparing tablets, and as an avid Amazon-user I thought I had made a well informed choice. Wrong. This tablet honestly stinks. The technology seems half-baked. Some of the programs work flawlessly while others are glitchy and frustrating. For example, I can't even access the app store but the silk internet browser works fine! The app store half loads, and none of the links even work. It's definitely not my internet connection, because all of my other devices are running flawlessly. I read a bunch of blogs and tried doing a few things (resetting time/date settings, restarting the kindle, checking internet settings...) I am just so disappointed. As a Mac user, I probably should have shelled out the extra cash and went with the iPad. I am returning this tablet after only one day. Even worse, the Mayday button won't connect me to customer service! It just loads for a while and then reports an error in connection. A rare miss for my Amazon experience.
Reviews.Title: So disappointed

Reviews.Author: FromUtah
Reviews.Content: This device is a handy little device, good graphics, amazingly large sound.  Runs fast, apps that come with it work fine.But...If you want access to all of the open source a freely available software from Google, don't buy this!!!  It is not available, nor will it ever be.  That mean no Google Play, Google Maps, Google Navigation, Google Search, Google Chrome, Google Docs, Google Translate... You get the picture.  Why would anyone want to limit themselves to the offerings at the amazon App Store with such a great little tablet?  Kindle Fire HDX is just a version of Android with an Amazon makeover.  Every aspect of this experience of using this device seems to be geared toward getting you to spend money at Amazon.  Right off the bat you are given a free month of Amazon Prime, the service that costs $79 per year.  They offer streaming videos, but, everything here is on Netflix.  Netflix has more.  Most TV series let you view the first episode for free, but all others cost money.Did I mention, the startup screen is a full-page add for some random irrelevant gadget on Amazon?  And, The top of the screen on the launcher page is, you guessed it, another link bar to Amazon Store Categories for you to accidently click when you want to slide down the top bar to check what messages have been displayed.Now, let's talk google.  Google invented the droid operating system and the google play store has everything under the sun for Android.  Apps like Google Chrome, Gmail, Google Maps, Navigation, Google Drive.  These are not available on the Amazon store.  They really make up the backbone of productivity on the Android system.  Amazon seems to only want you to use this for entertainment, on a pay-as-you-go basis.I'll be looking for a way to load generic Android, or selling this on eBay.Amazon, if you read these, please come out with a more open update for this device's operating system.  I feel like a sucker for getting this.Mine is for sale.
Reviews.Title: OK, one star says I hate it, not the device, but the experience.

Reviews.Author: Chad Homme
Reviews.Content: My wife has had a Kindle for a while and I decided to get one.  This is nothing short of incredible.  Screen clarity is amazing, battery life is great.  Couldn't ask for a better reader/tablet.
Reviews.Title: This is the tablet/ereader to get!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had every single Kindle Fire, but this new HDX is, hands down, one of the most innovative tablets ever. The two best features are the Mayday button and the song lyrics. No tablet that I'm aware of has any support even close to the Mayday button. You simply tap the onscreen button and, voila, a person comes on your screen and helps you. A real person you can see. The can't see you, but they can see your screen. I've used it a couple of times and never waited more than 10-15 seconds before they were right there speaking to me. AMAZING!Second, the new rolling lyrics with your music is awesome, however,  not many songs have the lyrics yet. I'm sure they're working on the data base, but the more current songs are available. On some albums some songs are done but not all. Great idea and hopefully Amazon is bringing lyrics in quickly.And let's not forget xray for movies. Tap the screen and you'll get a pop-up with movie info like the names of which actors are on the screen at any given moment. Awesome!Awesome machine... If it just had front AND rear facing cameras it would be perfect. It does have front facing, but not rear. Try it you'll love it! I hope the Mayday button catches on across the industry because support is usually so difficult! Way to go Amazon!
Reviews.Title: It just gets better and better!

Reviews.Author: Marwan
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 7" tablet, but I was not sure if I buy the Nexus 7 or the Kindle fire HDX. Eventually I went and bought this device and I am really happy and satisfied. It can do pretty much everything you need!! You can download missing apps from outside sources, so it is not a big deal. Its performance really great and I have never been disappointed so far, the only problem I noticed that this device missing a navigation apps and Google maps doesn't work as expected on it! Beside this issue, the Kindle fire HDX is flawless!
Reviews.Title: Really good buy!

Reviews.Author: William Mutschler "Copper Moose"
Reviews.Content: I debated heavily over this, putting it on my one and only thing for Christmas. I wanted to see the performance and size of this, including thin-ness. The color and clarity are simply stunningly fantastic -- better than any other tablet that I've seen. The FAA discount day enabled me to get it at 15% off, enabling me to afford the 64 GB  (my other spec wish-feature), even though I had to use my debit card because…….the day before. I had bought a reconditioned 8.9" Kindle HD, with 32 gb the day before with Amazon Card, but haven't opened it, knowing that this would be here a day later.My kids have filled their Kindles with game crap, but I wanted the extra space to have more books downloaded at the same time, and more space for movies, music and 'future expansion space.'One might laugh, but as a comics fan I read the volume collections. A little small for my old eyes, so I'm sort of forced to use panel view. But, for USA Today, the smallest text size was just perfect. That is an auto format site, and works great.Finally, my OWN Kindle. I had been sharing one used by my son, but now, no more swapping. No drained battery for dear old dad.I don't see a speed difference yet (I'm not a gamer), but this thing is THIN. I'm hoping to get longer battery life with a smaller screen.The only thing so far is that I am adjusting to a smaller Kindle, having been using the 8.9 HD.
Reviews.Title: Simply AWESOME display. Super THIN. WOW!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Z. McMenemy
Reviews.Content: I love it. I went for the slow dumb first gen Kindle to this power house it is amazing love it
Reviews.Title: That Upgrade

Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my new Kindle. I have wanted one for about a year so when I heard this new one came out, I definitely wanted one. The resolution is awesome, everything is very quick, I've even resorted to just watching Netflix with the Kindle instead of my TV. The apps/books download very quick and the battery life is awesome on it. The only gripe I will say I have is the fact that you can't change the opening background of it. The picture doesn't bother me but it would of been nice to be able to use my own picture instead of the one they gave. I can't wait to take this to the beach and be able to read my books and not worry! I would recommend this to anybody!
Reviews.Title: I would buy another one!

Reviews.Author: Cano85
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Does just what I want it to do.  Sharp pics and fast.  A definite recommend.I've been waiting for over a year to purchase one and then the new HDX came out so I'm glad I waited.
Reviews.Title: A great product!  A definite must have.

Reviews.Author: Darren A. Wallace "babysealclubber"
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it. I also have a kindle fire HD, and when I compared watching HD movies side by side there was a visible difference between the HDX and HD. The added 64 GB HD is awesome, my wife can now keep pictures, and she uses it for a lot of things. All in all, I really like the kindle, it's not too big, and not too expensive.
Reviews.Title: Worth the upgrade

Reviews.Author: Brian Jones
Reviews.Content: I am a Apple fan from the ipod, to ipad, Iphone to Macbook Pro.  I have always felt that every tablet device paled in comparison the the Apple suite of products.  I was wrong.  After using for only a few days I was impressed.  The graphics are amazing (resolution and pixel density). The brightness is also better than the new iPad Air.I also like the new Mayday feature.  Seriously, Apple really dropped it on this feature.  Amazon definitely put the consumers first by allowing a live video chat user like directly to customer service.  They can solve problems easily by taking over your device to make fixes.It has a great battery life and it is super fast.  I give high recommendations for the Kindle Fire.  Apple, you better watch out......
Reviews.Title: Apple, you better watch out.....The Kindle Fire is checking it twice!!

Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet a little over a week.  I enjoy it more as I use it more.  I used MayDay on the first day.  It worked as advertised. I was questioning about an App that I had on the Kindle Fire HD that is not compatible to the HDX.  I was told that APPS will be worked to take advantage of the higher quality display.  That seemed to be a reasonable answer.Even though I had the Fire HD, I never used the Silk browser much at all.  I am now familiarizing myself with this browser and that is going well.  I do have a slight bluish haze on the page as I read, but I do not find it distracting.  I viewed part of an episode  of a TV  program I bought through Amazon and the picture and sound were excellent.The weight makes this tablet easy to hold.  Unless I am sitting at my desk and propping up the HDX, I will normally remove it from the Oragami case.  The case works well when I need it, though.I have the HDX chiefly because I like Immersion Reading.  It performs excellently at this task.  And the light weight makes it easy to listen/read at night.  Sound quality is excellent also.
Reviews.Title: A very good tablet
